summary: Marcus Aurelius urges himself to remain focused on the present moment, fulfill his duty, avoid distraction, and maintain the clarity and discipline necessary to act according to nature and reason. He warns against being pulled into anxieties about the future, overthinking the past, or being consumed by others' opinions.

micro_lessons.title: Act Only on What Is Before You
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus emphasizes focusing entirely on the task at hand rather than scattering attention across past regrets or future worries.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What should you give your full attention to?
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: The task directly in front of you.

micro_lessons.title: The Present Moment Is All You Own
micro_lessons.core_idea: Everything outside the present moment is beyond your control, and worrying about it drains energy unnecessarily.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What is the only time that truly belongs to you?

micro_lessons.title: Duty Over Distraction
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus connects virtue with the disciplined fulfillment of one's duty, rather than being swayed by emotions or impulses.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: How does Marcus define virtue in daily life?
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: Performing your duty without distraction or complaint.

micro_lessons.title: Do Not Waste Time on Unnecessary Thoughts
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus criticizes drifting into daydreams, fantasies, or anxieties that serve no useful purpose.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What does Marcus describe as mental waste?

micro_lessons.title: Your Actions Reflect Your Philosophy
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus insists that your real philosophy is shown by your conduct, not your words or beliefs.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: Where is your true philosophy displayed?

micro_lessons.title: Avoid Being Pulled by Others' Agendas
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus warns against allowing other people's desires or expectations to hijack your focus.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What should you guard against when dealing with others?
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: Letting their priorities replace your own rational purpose.

micro_lessons.title: The Mind Becomes What It Dwells On
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus teaches that thoughts shape character, and repeated rumination builds habits.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: According to Marcus, what determines your character?
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: The thoughts you consistently dwell on.

micro_lessons.title: Simplify Your Life
micro_lessons.core_idea: A cluttered mind leads to a cluttered life; focusing on essentials brings clarity.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What is the benefit of simplifying your thoughts and actions?

micro_lessons.title: Stop Arguing With Reality
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus urges embracing circumstances as they are and acting rationally within them.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What should you stop doing to live rationally?

micro_lessons.title: Don’t Fear the Future
micro_lessons.core_idea: Fear arises from anticipation, not actual events. Anticipation is your imagination, not reality.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: Where does fear come from, according to Marcus?
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: From imagining future events, not the events themselves.

micro_lessons.title: Do Not Be a Slave to Praise
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus warns that craving approval weakens your autonomy and drags you off your path.
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: Because it makes you dependent on others' opinions.

micro_lessons.title: Stay Rooted in Your Purpose
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus teaches that your purpose—your role as a rational, social being—should guide your decisions.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What should guide your decisions and actions?

micro_lessons.title: Focus on What the Work Requires
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus encourages ignoring ego, discomfort, or impatience and concentrating solely on what the work demands.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: When working, what should determine your focus?
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: The requirements of the work itself.

micro_lessons.title: Do Not Be Distracted by What Others Think
micro_lessons.core_idea: Most of what others think is irrelevant or based on their own distortions.
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: Because they are usually based on distortions and irrelevant to your purpose.

micro_lessons.title: Return to Yourself Often
micro_lessons.core_idea: Marcus recommends checking in with yourself throughout the day to maintain clarity and virtue.
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: To regain clarity and stay aligned with reason.

micro_lessons.title: Let Reason Guide Every Choice
micro_lessons.core_idea: Reason acts as a lens through which confusion and emotion are filtered.
micro_lessons.micro_test_q: What helps you filter confusion and emotion?

micro_lessons.title: Avoid Complaining
micro_lessons.core_idea: Complaining weakens resolve and signals a belief that life should be easier than it is.
micro_lessons.micro_test_a: Because it weakens your resolve and distorts reality.
